items.title: Energy Transfer Launches Natural Gas Deliveries to Oracle Data Center
items.summary: Energy Transfer LP (ET) has begun deliveries of natural gas to Oracle Corp.’s massive Texas data center, marking the start of what the firm bets could be a rippling wave of demand for Permian Basin and Haynesville Shale natural gas.

items.title: Futures Settle: Springlike Pattern Reshapes Natural Gas Market Outlook, Pressures Prices
items.summary: Record weekend warmth across major demand hubs sent natural gas prices lower as traders anticipated ample supply heading into the spring shoulder season.

items.title: Weekly Natural Gas Storage Report Likely to Show a Partial Reversal of Fern’s Impact
items.summary: NGI is projecting the latest Lower 48 U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA) storage report for the week ended Feb. 13 to show a withdrawal of 144 Bcf.

items.title: MidDay Snapshot: Western Weather Demand Props Up Natural Gas Cash Prices
items.summary: Next-day natural gas spot prices rallied in the West and bolstered the national average as of Tuesday’s midday data run.

items.title: Enbridge Eyes 50 Data Center Projects as Natural Gas Demand Surges
items.summary: Canadian midstreamer Enbridge Inc. sees a massive data center opportunity in North America that could require up to 10 Bcf/d of incremental gas capacity.

items.title: LNG Floods Europe, Keeping Lid on TTF Prices Despite Storage Deficit
items.summary: A steady influx of LNG to Europe, combined with exceptionally weak Asian demand are keeping global natural gas prices low as the winter draws to a close.

items.title: MidDay Futures: Natural Gas Prices Stumble as Old Man Winter Whimpers
items.summary: Natural gas futures slumped early Tuesday and floundered into midday as rising production and lighter weather demand overshadowed strengthening LNG activity.

items.title: Midmorning Markets: Technical Support Keeping Natural Gas Futures Above $3 as Forecasts Fail to Impress
items.summary: Technically oversold conditions could provide a lifeline for struggling March natural gas futures, which have struggled to find momentum amid bearish supply and demand data.

items.title: Guyana Fast-Tracks Gas Expansion as Oil Cash Piles Up
items.summary: Guyana’s sights are set much higher than just being the new oil darling of the Western hemisphere. It wants to be the gas darling too.  That’s the frame coming out of Georgetown as Guyana lines up a second gas pipeline project, even before the first

items.title: Oil Slips: Iran Talks, Ukraine Blockade, and VLCC Crunch Drive Price Movement
items.summary: This week's energy newsletter reviews oil and gas price shifts, U.S. rig count figures, key corporate acquisitions and discoveries, and analyzes major geopolitical events impacting global oil trade, including shipping market manipulation and rising C

items.title: Drone Strikes Force Russia to Reroute Massive Crude Oil Exports
items.summary: As Ukrainian strikes on Russia’s refineries and the halt of Ukrainian shipments of Russian oil to central EU member states limit outlets of Russian crude, Moscow is boosting shipments via ports.   Russia’s seaborne crude oil exports averaged 3.39 mil

items.title: Oil Prices Fall as Iran and U.S. Conclude Second Round of Nuclear Talks
items.summary: A second round of indirect talks between Iran and the United States over Tehran's nuclear program concluded on February 17, according to Iran's state broadcaster. The outcome remains unclear, as neither side has issued a statement or spoken to the me

items.title: Turkey Begins Ultra-Deepwater Oil Drilling in Horn of Africa
